Text.Value: I'm more than my magic. Right?
An owlbear's pissed in your porridge, from the sounds of it. Just remember: I'm not your enemy here.
Yes - I need my powers back now.
Call on your ancestor. You will not submit!
Your business is mine, and vice versa. We're relying on each other, remember?
Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.
Or perhaps they found a better life with a new owner. Time will tell.
Magic's a part of me - it'll come back when it's ready.
You're right. We've survived worse problems than this.
Finely spotted. I've developed a taste for this pastime you call 'humour'.

EditorData.NodeContext: Very pleased with herself that player realised she was joking

Text.Value: 'Nothing' is doing a number on you, then, but suit yourself.
And if I'm not?
You are as modest as you are warm, Lae'zel.
And I'll be delighted to see you try - from a safe distance.
Your confidence grows. I'd almost think you believed your own words.
Your pace has slowed. Are you unwell?
Now come, and be heedful. The shadows are watching.
It is the same for me. We're sitting ducks among sussur flowers, you and I.
It's the bloody Underdark. Never know what mad shit you're gonna run into down here.
True. My powers will return if they're meant to - like a pet cat. Or maybe a feral one.
Then I'll have your back. When my allies are in danger, I'm not in the habit of turning away.
Might I suggest getting it back? We can't have anything happen to our favourite sorcerer now, can we?
So what do you have left to contribute? Your personality? Let's just hope those powers return soon.
The feeling is very mutual, my friend.
*Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

Text.Value: It's the flower - my magic is gone.
I... forgive me.
Then I'll have your back. Isn't that what friends do?
Perhaps this will cure you of some self-delusion then. Come on.
I really hope you're right.
Have you known me to joke?
Like you've lost a friend. Without your ancestor, it's too quiet.
More than you.
Then I shall make up for your shortcomings. As I have all along.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not as snippy as usual. Subtly joking.

Text.Value: Mind your own damn business.
Disturbed. No chaos? No thank you.
From this angle, there's nothing you can't endure.
Indifferent. If your power is truly yours it will return to you.
From what I've seen, your talents extend well beyond magic. Trust me - you'll be fine.
Oh don't be such a pill, darling. We're just having a little fun.

EditorData.NodeContext: Someone you like isn't joking along with you

Text.Value: Speak for yourself. I hate sitting, and I never quack in public.
Yes, I'll just 'get it back' - what a helpful suggestion, thank you!
No harm in a brief dose of perspective. It'll pass, I'm sure.

EditorData.NodeContext: Putting a positive spin on things.

Text.Value: Well done. You're beginning to trust your convictions.
That's the spirit. Now let's get moving, before anything else goes missing.
Chin up - I'll wager they'll come back as soon as we move away from here.
That 'nothing' sure looks like something to me. If you need to rest, just say the word.
*You have been alone before, but this isolation is alien. The sooner you get away from this flower, the better.*
What's wrong - is the plant getting to you? You look sicker than a drunk derro.
In that case, I've got just one thing to say - 'Meow'.
No, you don't get it - this is really bad.
This is serious. I feel terrible. Empty.
Furious. How dare a wretched flower take what is yours?
*With or without your powers you're at ease. Magic cannot be tamed - not even by you.*
Please. I'm every bit the combatant you claim to be.
They'll return if they're meant to - like a pet cat. Or maybe a feral one.
Hardly. But go on, live your fantasy. I am not about to stop you.
'Mind your own damn business, I'm busy inserting my head into my arse.'
Try to cast a simple cantrip.
Fight it. You need your magic. You need it!
Need I remind you you're addressing a wizard? I know what's going on - it's happening to me as well.
Your sense of humour is still intact, at least.
I can swing a sword too if I must.
Then let's watch each other's backs.
Our backs are very much prone to stabbing in this environment. So by all means - let's.
And I'm the queen of Baldur's Gate. But all right - let's move.
Sarcasm. Magnificent.
*The boredom is like an itch you cannot scratch. The sooner you deal with this flower, the better.*
Your good health is our business - our alliance depends on it. I suggest you remember that.
We'll work it out. We always do.
Hey - what's wrong? You look spooked.
You must be joking.
Fear is a normal response when one feels one's magic slipping away. No need to lash out.
Let's finish up here quickly - the sooner we can get your magic back, the safer we'll be. Until then, try not to die.
*Your magic erupts, violent and powerful, but is snuffed out by the sussur flower - vanishing like embers in the wind.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player clenches fingers, eyes closed in furious concentration, but to no avail. Eyes open wide in surprise - their magic is gone

Text.Value: Then gather your wits - these amateur dramatics wear thin.
*For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: No one to include, so speaker 1 is the only speaker in this dialog.

Text.Value: Oh, pardon. I'll leave you to drop dead in your own time, then.

EditorData.NodeContext: Responding to "mind your own damn business"

Text.Value: If you say so, soldier. Might want to start learning to swing a sword. Stay behind me until then - I'll crack anyone who messes with you.
What's the matter? I could swear this plant's got you flush.
*The magic in your fingers sparks but your spells fail again and again - consumed by the sussur flower.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Holds out a hand, flicks it as if trying to cast a spell, which fails. Tries one more time. Player looks curious at hand, but not too concerned.

Text.Value: Mind flayers buried tadpoles in our brains, and then we crashed to the ground on the banks of the Chionthar.
You've no flair for insults. Let's go, before I'm tempted to give you a lesson.
Of course I am. You're not going to be undone by a flower, are you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Playful; verbally poking fun at the player.

Text.Value: A temporary setback - I'm sure my powers will be back soon.
*A quiet contentment settles in your chest. Perhaps a life without power would not be so terrible.*
If you say so. You're the conduit for raw, cosmic power after all.
All right, if you say so.
That flower isn't agreeing with you, is it? Doesn't sit well with me either.
Don't flatter yourself.
Quack.
*A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

Text.Value: Something's wrong - your manner betrays you. What curse has this plant wrought?
That's not funny. It feels like I've lost a limb.
It took your power and your sense of humour? How wretched.
No worse than having mind flayers bury a tadpole your brain, or crashing to the ground on the banks of the Chionthar.
That's usually my line. Suddenly seems unconvincing, hearing it from someone else.
Just my good looks, then.
*Your magic is gone, replaced by fury. You and your powers are one - this will be temporary.*
At ease. Without magic things feels so peaceful.
You look drained, and I know it wasn't me. Is the plant bothering you?
Might I suggest getting it back? I don't travel with you for your personality, you know.
Gone gone? But... you're a sorcerer. Isn't magic... you?
I'm not worried. My powers will return if they're meant to.
Let's finish up here and then get away from that damned plant. Until then, we'll keep you safe.
Until then, let me lead the way. Anything pops out from under a mushroom, and I'll make sure it doesn't grab my poor powerless pal.
I'm fine. It's nothing.

Synopsis: A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.
